clinical_study.brief_title: IS There a Correlation Between Sypmtoms of Gastroparesis and the Duration of Video Caspule Retention in the Stomach
clinical_study.official_title: Open Prospective Single Center Study for the Determination of Correlation Between Video Capsule Period of Retention in the Stomach and Symptoms of Gastroparesis

brief_summary.textblock: Gastroparesis is a syndrome characterized by delayed gastric emptying in absence of mechanical obstruction of the stomach. The cardinal symptoms include postprandial fullness (early satiety), nausea, vomiting, and bloating.Capsule endoscopy (CE) has evolved to become a first-line, noninvasive diagnostic technique for the small bowel. CE is now being utilized to assess patients for obscure gastrointestinal bleeding, possible Crohn's disease, celiac disease and small bowel tumors. Capsule endoscopy is preformed in a fasting state, and usually past the pylorus of the stomach into the duodenum after up to 30-40 minutes. The aim of the study is to determine the correlation between gasytoparesis symptoms to duration of capsule retention in the stomach

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of capsule retention in the stomach

arm_group.description: Every subject having capsule endoscopy for any indication

study_pop.textblock: Any patient undergoing small bowel video capsule examination for any indication
